User.title: User
User.description: Represents a user account within the Aravalli Home Studio application.

id.description: Unique identifier for the user, matches Firebase Auth UID.

signUpDate.description: Date and time when the user signed up.

Product.title: Product
Product.description: Represents a product offered by Aravalli Steel PVC Furniture.

category.description: Category of the product (e.g., chair, table).

orderDate.description: Date and time when the order was placed.

status.description: Status of the order (e.g., pending, processing, completed).

OrderItem.title: OrderItem
OrderItem.description: Represents an item within an order.

id.description: Unique identifier for the order item.

quantity.description: Quantity of the product in the order item.

itemPrice.description: Price of the item at the time of the order.

VisitorGreeting.title: VisitorGreeting
VisitorGreeting.description: Represents a greeting message displayed to visitors.

id.description: Unique identifier for the greeting message.

displayFrom.description: Date and time from which the message should be displayed.

displayUntil.description: Date and time until which the message should be displayed.

firestore.reasoning: The Firestore structure is designed to ensure Authorization Independence, DBAC, and support secure list operations (QAPs). User data is stored under `/users/{userId}`. Products are stored in a top-level `/products` collection. Orders are stored in `/users/{userId}/orders/{orderId}`, reflecting the user-order relationship. Order items are stored in `/users/{userId}/orders/{orderId}/order_items/{orderItemId}` to maintain hierarchy. ProductCustomization is stored under `/users/{userId}/product_customizations/{productCustomizationId}`. Visitor greetings are stored in a global `/visitor_greetings` collection. This design uses path-based ownership for user-related data and segregates data with different access needs into separate collections, such as public products and user-specific orders. This approach avoids hierarchical authorization dependencies. This achieves Authorization Independence because access to subcollections (orders, order items, product customizations) is based solely on the `request.auth.uid` matching the `userId` in the path.
